meanings.definition: To cause a spacecraft or satellite to move out of its orbit around a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The mission control team deorbits the satellite for a controlled reentry.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut deorbits the spacecraft to prepare for landing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous alien deorbits the satellite as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The sudden solar flare deorbits the spacecraft from its path.
meanings.sent5: The powerful gravitational pull deorbits the satellite with ease.

meanings.definition: To move a spacecraft or satellite out of its orbit around a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The engineers deorbits the satellite to avoid space debris.
meanings.sent2: The space agency deorbits the spacecraft to end its mission.
meanings.sent3: The curious child deorbits the toy satellite in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The magnetic interference deorbits the spacecraft unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The thruster malfunction deorbits the satellite off course.
